intro: Pluchea grevei var. congesta, commonly known as the clustered false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks. Its leaves are usually alternate, with a rough texture and serrated edges.
